name: Martin
headline: AI Personal Assistant like Jarvis
description: Call, text, or email Martin. He manages your calendar, inbox, to-do lists, and Slack. He can send texts, make calls, set reminders, search the web, and more.
tags: industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:generative-ai; industry:consumer; industry:ai; industry:ai-assistant; location:san-francisco-bay-area

  * ### Like having an extra brain
Having Martin as my personal assistant has been a total game-changer. From seamlessly integrating with my existing apps to proactively anticipating my needs, he's made my life so much more organized and efficient.
Product Hunt, March 2024
  * ### Wow, I am truly amazed.
This is so much more than any other voice AI I know. You can access Martin using your phone, but you are also able to connect to various device and platforms like [email, calendar, and SMS]
Product Hunt, March 2024
  * ### The best one out there
The best ai secretary for adhd people who keep forgetting things…overall this is a dream come true for everyone looking for personal ai assistant in a true sense
App Store, May 2024
  * ### Like a Butler in Your Phone
Martin has a super simple interface and unlike Siri remembers your preferences, which is great for custom workflows. I’d recommend Martin to people who want to remove grunt work from their lives. I’m optimistic that Martin will only become more useful and popular.

generated_description:
**Company Overview: Martin**

Founded in 2023 and hailing from the dynamic San Francisco Bay Area, Martin is an AI personal assistant that aspires to be as versatile and helpful as Tony Stark's Jarvis. The company's mission is to simplify your digital life by managing a range of tasks typically handled by personal assistants, all powered by cutting-edge artificial intelligence technologies.

### What Martin Does

Initially conceived with functionalities for calls, texts, and emails, Martin has evolved to manage calendars, inboxes, to-do lists, and Slack communications. You can ask Martin to send texts, set reminders, make calls, search the internet, and even manage your workflow seamlessly. The idea is simple: Martin keeps everything organized in his working memory, so you don’t have to stress about remembering all the details.

### Features & Usability

The impressive features include:
- **Task Management**: From setting reminders for meal prep to rearranging meetings, Martin makes day-to-day scheduling effortless.
- **Communication Management**: He can read your emails, draft replies, and even send messages on your behalf.
- **Integrated Experience**: Martin is designed to integrate with popular platforms like Slack, enhancing workplace productivity.

For a firsthand experience, users can visit [trymartin.com](https://www.trymartin.com/) to get started, view pricing options, or book a demo.

### Backing and Recognition

Martin is part of Y Combinator's Batch S23, showcasing its potential in the startup ecosystem. Recently, the company secured a $2 million seed round, strengthening its resources for development and expansion.

### Team and Leadership

With a lean team of two employees, Martin operates under the guidance of Jared Friedman, an experienced Group Partner. The startup's small size contrasts with its ambitious mission to revolutionize personal assistance through technology.

### User Experience

The feedback from users is overwhelmingly positive. Many describe Martin as a game-changer for productivity. Users consistently praise the intuitive interface, the ability to remember personal preferences, and the practical features that allow them to focus on larger tasks rather than mundane details.

Overall, Martin is positioned to significantly enhance productivity and reduce mental load for users, making it an indispensable tool for anyone looking to streamline their daily tasks. Whether you’re a busy professional, a student, or someone managing multiple tasks, Martin aims to support your journey towards a more organized life.
